question: In many countries people are living in a throw away society where things are used for a short time and throw away. what are the causes of this and what problems does it lead to?
text: Living in societies where inhabitants use objects as disposable has been the subject of debate in contemporary states. Time is the most reason for the usage short term of materials. however, by some approaches we can reduce this trouble that causes environmental pollution.

Nowadays, many people are under pressure. So, they have to break laws for finding enough time for daily routine. many commentators are of the view that there are many reasons cause this difficulty. Furthermore, Based on some essays this issue had been caused by stakeholders. As a consequence, this group, they have been bringing down the cost of products and on other hand, could make money by this path. For instance, when you purchase disposable dishes, after one use throws them away. While you can utilize high-quality containers for a long-time and save money. Might be used of them as recycling by the government but the cost of this cycle is high and lead to air pollution. There are some approaches that using of them can lessen problems. It is up to the government that broadcast some important notices related to optimization usage of everything we use during the day. Moreover, alternative new materials for multiple use or different usage of them in our life for decrease living expenses. For example, by using dissimilar disposable glasses in a new functional form as a pot, we can be successful thrift in our lives.

To su up, throughout the world, inhabitants have not been using materials in the best way and after a short time get rid of them. Also, having less time in our lives and being easy-going is the certain reason this big disaster. This trouble will be solved by cooperation between the people and the government.

error_list.error_des: It appears that you are missing a comma after the introductory phrase by some approaches. Consider adding a comma.
It seems that there is a pronoun problem here.
It appears that you have an unnecessary comma before the dependent clause marker after. Consider removing the comma.
The singular countable noun use follows the quantifier multiple, which requires a plural noun. Consider using a plural noun or a different quantifier.
If you do not want su to be marked as misspelled in the future, you can add it to your personal dictionary.
The verb is appears to be unnecessary here.
It seems that preposition use may be incorrect here.
